description: Grants permission to invoke the specified Bedrock model to run inference using the input provided in the request body with streaming response.

unverifiedMitreAttackTechniques.reason: Attackers could potentially exploit the model invocation process to execute arbitrary commands or scripts, depending on how the input data to the model is handled and interpreted.
The streaming response can be used to automatically exfiltrate data as it is processed by the model.
The streaming response feature can be exploited to send sensitive data back to an attacker over an established C2 channel.

If the Bedrock model has access to and processes local system data, attackers could leverage the API call to collect sensitive information. This scenario assumes that the model's processing involves data that might include confidential or proprietary information.
DNS can be used for exfiltration or command and control if the model's streaming response can be encoded into DNS queries/responses.

securityImplications: Attackers might use InvokeModelWithResponseStream to invoke the model for resource hijacking.
